items.title: Boeing Starliner astronauts who were supposed to be in space for nine days returning to Earth after nine months on ISS
items.content: Two NASA astronauts are heading home on a SpaceX ship after about nine months at the International Space Station.
items.contentSnippet: Two NASA astronauts are heading home on a SpaceX ship after about nine months at the International Space Station.

items.title: Cadillac expects one of every three vehicle sales to be EVs in 2025
items.content: Cadillac expects up to 35% of its U.S. sales this year to be EVs, as it continues to expand its lineup despite industrywide slower-than-expected adoption.
items.contentSnippet: Cadillac expects up to 35% of its U.S. sales this year to be EVs, as it continues to expand its lineup despite industrywide slower-than-expected adoption.

items.title: Forever 21 expected to close all U.S. stores, blames Shein and Temu for demise
items.content: Forever 21 blamed its second bankruptcy on rising competition from upstarts like Shein and Temu and their use of the de minimis exemption, a trade law loophole.
items.contentSnippet: Forever 21 blamed its second bankruptcy on rising competition from upstarts like Shein and Temu and their use of the de minimis exemption, a trade law loophole.

items.title: PepsiCo buys prebiotic soda brand Poppi for nearly $2 billion
items.content: Poppi's founders Allison and Stephen Ellsworth launched the brand back in 2018.
items.contentSnippet: Poppi's founders Allison and Stephen Ellsworth launched the brand back in 2018.

items.title: Klarna, nearing IPO, plucks lucrative Walmart fintech partnership from rival Affirm
items.content: The deal with Walmart heightens the rivalry between Affirm and Klarna, two of the world's biggest BNPL players, just as Klarna is set to go public.
items.contentSnippet: The deal with Walmart heightens the rivalry between Affirm and Klarna, two of the world's biggest BNPL players, just as Klarna is set to go public.

items.title: Goodbye to 'bags fly free' on Southwest Airlines, the last freebie in America
items.content: Southwest's customer-focused business model won it a loyal following during its half-century of flying.
items.contentSnippet: Southwest's customer-focused business model won it a loyal following during its half-century of flying.

items.title: U.S. consumers are starting to crack as tariffs add to inflation, recession concerns
items.content: Airline and retail executives are bracing for a slowdown in demand amid concerns tariffs will cut down consumer spending.
items.contentSnippet: Airline and retail executives are bracing for a slowdown in demand amid concerns tariffs will cut down consumer spending.

items.title: Ulta issues weak guidance, citing consumer uncertainty, rising competition and company missteps
items.content: Ulta Beauty warned that profits and revenue will be worse than Wall Street expected in the year ahead.
items.contentSnippet: Ulta Beauty warned that profits and revenue will be worse than Wall Street expected in the year ahead.

items.title: DC housing market shows signs of cracks amid mass federal layoffs
items.content: The number of active listings in the D.C. metro area is sharply higher compared with last year.
items.contentSnippet: The number of active listings in the D.C. metro area is sharply higher compared with last year.

items.title: Spirit Airlines, fresh from bankruptcy, is ready to take on the new Southwest, CEO says
items.content: Spirit Airlines emerged from Chapter 11 bankruptcy this week, meeting its target to exit in the first quarter.
items.contentSnippet: Spirit Airlines emerged from Chapter 11 bankruptcy this week, meeting its target to exit in the first quarter.

items.title: New York AG announces bill to protect consumers from scams after Trump hobbles CFPB
items.content: With the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau frozen, consumers will have to rely on their state AGs and regulators when they have complaints.
items.contentSnippet: With the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau frozen, consumers will have to rely on their state AGs and regulators when they have complaints.

items.title: Comcast expands partnership with Olympics, extends media rights through 2036
items.content: Comcast gained the rights to broadcast the Olympic Games through 2036 as part of a new $3 billion agreement with the International Olympic Committee.
items.contentSnippet: Comcast gained the rights to broadcast the Olympic Games through 2036 as part of a new $3 billion agreement with the International Olympic Committee.

items.title: Dollar General CEO warns consumers are cash-strapped, and says 2025 won't be better
items.content: Tariffs and potential changes to government entitlement programs present potential further headwinds for core customers, said CEO Todd Vasos.
items.contentSnippet: Tariffs and potential changes to government entitlement programs present potential further headwinds for core customers, said CEO Todd Vasos.

items.title: Dollar General store review and closures dent fourth-quarter earnings
items.content: As part of the reevaluation, the dollar-store chain said it will close 96 Dollar General stores and 45 Popshelf stores and will convert six other locations.
items.contentSnippet: As part of the reevaluation, the dollar-store chain said it will close 96 Dollar General stores and 45 Popshelf stores and will convert six other locations.

items.title: White House pulls Trump’s nomination for CDC director hours before confirmation hearing
items.content: The White House pulled Weldon's nomination just hours before the former Florida lawmaker was set to appear before the U.S. Senate for confirmation.
items.contentSnippet: The White House pulled Weldon's nomination just hours before the former Florida lawmaker was set to appear before the U.S. Senate for confirmation.

items.title: Women's sports firm Monarch Collective ups fund size to $250 million
items.content: Monarch investors Melinda French Gates’ Pivotal Ventures and Hello Sunshine CEO Sarah Harden recently upped their funding.
items.contentSnippet: Monarch investors Melinda French Gates’ Pivotal Ventures and Hello Sunshine CEO Sarah Harden recently upped their funding.

items.title: American Eagle says consumer is slowing down, issues weak guidance
items.content: American Eagle warned that consumers are slowing down as recession fears swirl.
items.contentSnippet: American Eagle warned that consumers are slowing down as recession fears swirl.

items.title: Take a look inside the world's largest 3D printed housing development
items.content: The world's largest 3D printed community is now open and mostly sold. Take a look inside the homes and hear from residents about what it's like to live there.
items.contentSnippet: The world's largest 3D printed community is now open and mostly sold. Take a look inside the homes and hear from residents about what it's like to live there.

items.title: RFK Jr. pressures Big Food to remove artificial dyes in meeting with CEOs
items.content: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. told top food CEOs that he wants "the worst ingredients" out of food.
items.contentSnippet: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. told top food CEOs that he wants "the worst ingredients" out of food.

items.title: Boeing plane prices could increase by millions with tariffs, says AerCap CEO
items.content: AerCap CEO Aengus Kelly joined CNBC's "Squawk Box" to discuss how tariffs could impact Boeing production.
items.contentSnippet: AerCap CEO Aengus Kelly joined CNBC's "Squawk Box" to discuss how tariffs could impact Boeing production.

items.title: Southwest Airlines will charge to check bags for the first time, launch basic economy tickets
items.content: Southwest is getting rid of its policy for free checked bags, ending a more than 50-year perk.
items.contentSnippet: Southwest is getting rid of its policy for free checked bags, ending a more than 50-year perk.

items.title: Southwest Airlines as we know it is over. Here's what's changing, from bag fees to basic economy
items.content: Southwest will start charging customers to check bags, launch basic economy tickets in a bid to drive up revenue.
items.contentSnippet: Southwest will start charging customers to check bags, launch basic economy tickets in a bid to drive up revenue.

items.title: Kohl's shares plunge 20% as retailer gives rough outlook for the year ahead
items.content: Kohl's posted a beat on revenue for the fourth quarter on Tuesday, but issued disappointing guidance for the year ahead.
items.contentSnippet: Kohl's posted a beat on revenue for the fourth quarter on Tuesday, but issued disappointing guidance for the year ahead.

items.title: Dick's Sporting Goods is latest retailer to forecast rocky 2025 as recession fears swirl
items.content: Dick's Sporting Goods issued weak guidance for 2025 as consumers contend with tariffs, persistent inflation and fears around a potential recession.
items.contentSnippet: Dick's Sporting Goods issued weak guidance for 2025 as consumers contend with tariffs, persistent inflation and fears around a potential recession.

items.title: Airline CEOs warn domestic travel demand is slowing
items.content: Airline CEOs say economic uncertainty and a drop in government travel is driving down domestic travel demand.
items.contentSnippet: Airline CEOs say economic uncertainty and a drop in government travel is driving down domestic travel demand.

items.title: Ad spending on women's sports more than doubled last year
items.content: Ads during women's sports programs were 40% more impactful than the average primetime advertisement, according to EDO.
items.contentSnippet: Ads during women's sports programs were 40% more impactful than the average primetime advertisement, according to EDO.

items.title: Delta Air Lines slashes earnings outlook on weaker U.S. demand, sending shares lower
items.content: Delta Air Lines cut its first-quarter revenue and profit forecasts, citing weaker consumer and corporate travel demand.
items.contentSnippet: Delta Air Lines cut its first-quarter revenue and profit forecasts, citing weaker consumer and corporate travel demand.

items.title: Trump finds unexpected ally in auto union leader over tariffs
items.content: UAW President Shawn Fain showed support for President Donald Trump's tariffs, which include 25% levies on automobiles and supporting parts.
items.contentSnippet: UAW President Shawn Fain showed support for President Donald Trump's tariffs, which include 25% levies on automobiles and supporting parts.

items.title: Here's why banks don’t want the CFPB to disappear
items.content: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and its employees are in limbo after acting Director Russell Vought took over last month.
items.contentSnippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and its employees are in limbo after acting Director Russell Vought took over last month.

items.title: RFK Jr. could further deter childhood vaccinations as rates fall in the U.S.
items.content: Some health policy experts say Kennedy's early moves as HHS Secretary are concerning and suggest that he could undermine immunizations in less direct ways.
items.contentSnippet: Some health policy experts say Kennedy's early moves as HHS Secretary are concerning and suggest that he could undermine immunizations in less direct ways.
